- Topic: Recognition of Chantell H. Reed, Deputy Director of the Health Department
- Summary: The council recognized Chantell H. Reed for her services as Deputy Director of the New Orleans Health Department and extended best wishes as she relocates to Portland, OR to work for the Multnomah County Health Department as Interim Director of Public Health.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition and best wishes extended to Chantell H. Reed
- Tags/Keywords: Recognition, Health Department, Chantell H. Reed
- UID: 44d58f43-33eb-4ba9-9e0f-1c17e436a874

- Topic: Resolution R-22-310
- Summary: The resolution reiterates that equal access to abortion care is essential for social and economic equality and reproductive autonomy. It condemns any action intended to abrogate the fundamental liberties of the people of the City of New Orleans while affirming the City Council's commitment to protecting the rights of its residents to make reproductive health decisions, including abortion care. It also requests that City funds controlled by specific departments not be used to solicit, catalog, report, or investigate reports of abortion.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-310
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (YEAS: 7, NAYS: 0, ABSTAIN: 0, ABSENT: 0)
- Decision/Key Actions: Resolution R-22-310 passed unanimously
- Tags/Keywords: Abortion care, Resolution, City funds
- UID: 44d58f43-33eb-4ba9-9e0f-1c17e436a874

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-7-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Classified Pay Plan Amendment for Emergency Medical Services (EMS) Employees
- Summary: The ordinance proposes an amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for EMS employees, making them eligible for a payment of $4,500 after twelve months of employment. The payments will commence either one year after the passage of this amendment or after the employee reaches one year tenure, whichever is later.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Received and referred to the budget committee
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Emergency Medical Services, Payment Eligibility
- UID: fc4d005d-45bc-4646-9395-ab5ad5282a49

- Topic: Special Rate of Pay Amendment for Fire Department Employees
- Summary: The amendment proposes special rates of pay for Fire Department employees assigned to specific units or engaged in certain temporary assignments. It includes a 5% increase for employees assigned to specific units and a 16.08% increase for those engaged in specific temporary assignments.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Special Rate of Pay, Fire Department, Amendment
- UID: fc4d005d-45bc-4646-9395-ab5ad5282a49
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-7-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Bilingual Salary Differential Allowance
- Summary: The amendment proposes a 5% increase in pay for employees who utilize bilingual skills (including American Sign Language) in their regular duties, subject to department approval and proficiency testing. The amendment also outlines eligibility requirements and procedures for receiving the bilingual salary differential allowance.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was approved by the council and referred to the Budget Committee for further review.
- Tags/Keywords: Bilingual Salary Differential, Civil Service, Language Proficiency, Pay Increase
- UID: 8de2596a-b05d-47b9-b1b1-6ca64fdc1560

- Topic: Amendment to Classified Pay Plan (Health Department)
- Summary: The amendment seeks Council approval for changes to the Classified Pay Plan within the Health Department, in accordance with the Louisiana Constitution. The details of the amendment were not explicitly provided in the summary.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 30/22
- Summary: The ordinance proposed an amendment to the text of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to incorporate Phase 1 proposals outlined by the City Planning Commission staff. This included expanding the allowed number of temporary outdoor entertainment events, expanding zoning districts for outdoor amphitheaters, and clarifying use standards for live entertainment. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "NO LEGAL MAJORITY".
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 30-22
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (4 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 3 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with 4 in favor and 2 against, with 3 council members absent.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, City Planning Commission, Amendment
- UID: f3548fa7-b12c-44e7-a358-ac123917398a

- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 34/22
- Summary: This ordinance requested a zoning change from an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District to an HU-RM2 Historic Urban Multi-Family Residential District for a specific location. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR APPROVAL".
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 7/21/22.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Historic Urban District, City Planning Commission
- UID: f3548fa7-b12c-44e7-a358-ac123917398a

messages.page_content:
- Topic: ZD NO. 34-22
- Summary: The motion was made to approve and grant the applicant's zoning change request on ZD NO. 34-22 with the proviso that no housing unit on the lot may be used as a short term rental. An amendment was later proposed to remove the proviso.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 34-22
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion (LYING OVER) - NO. M-22-307 - Passed - (N/A)
    Vote 2: AMENDMENT TO MOTION NO. M-22-307 - Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to remove the proviso was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning change, housing, short term rental
- UID: 01ff180d-6090-4e52-9f04-879664f2a3bd

- Topic: CAL. NO. 33,671
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to limit the power of the Mayor to suspend Article X of Chapter 2 of the Code of the City of New Orleans. It was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee for further discussion.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,671
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee for further discussion.
- Tags/Keywords: Mayor's power, Code of the City of New Orleans
- UID: 01ff180d-6090-4e52-9f04-879664f2a3bd

- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the next meeting for further discussion.

- Topic: Establishment of a Conditional Use for a Community Center
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to permit a community center in specific residential and design overlay districts. The specific location is bounded by Elysian Fields Avenue, Stephen Girard Street, Frenchmen Street, and Mandolin Street.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance requiring LEED Gold certification for public office buildings
- Summary: The ordinance requires all public office buildings constructed or rehabilitated by the City of New Orleans to meet the United States Green Buildings Council’s Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) Gold certification.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,744
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: LEED certification, public office buildings, energy efficiency
- UID: ce4e99b6-5590-44ff-bef3-c3be5171ae75

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance requiring LEED Gold certification
- Summary: The amendment adds a requirement of benchmarking for municipal buildings and post-LEED commissioning monitoring.
- Ordinance Number: Amendment to CAL. NO. 33,744
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment passed without further discussion.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, benchmarking, LEED certification
- UID: ce4e99b6-5590-44ff-bef3-c3be5171ae75

- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain specific sections of the City of New Orleans Code to distinguish bicycles and electric scooters and provide regulations for electric scooters. The ordinance was up for a vote and passed.

    - Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: This ordinance aims to require a Project Neighborhood Participation (NPP) for specific zoning amendments and institutional master plans. An amendment was proposed to include virtual or telephonic participation for certain zoning text and zoning map amendments.
- Ordinance Number: 33747
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
  - Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance was passed, including the proposed amendment to allow virtual or telephonic participation for certain zoning amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Neighborhood Participation, Amendment, Virtual Participation
- UID: 1d9ab06a-a2b4-484d-af60-ad7e31cf0919
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-7-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of City Code regarding vehicle fines and towing fees
- Summary: The ordinance aims to exempt vehicles involved in certain criminal offenses from fines and fees imposed by Chapter 162, Division 6 of the City Code and ensure that towing companies invoice fees associated with towing, recovery, and/or storage of vehicles involved in certain criminal offenses to the City of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,764
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted by the council.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code, vehicle fines, towing fees, criminal offenses
- UID: 4b89d374-34fd-4fa4-be43-53d2adfc6cfa

- Topic: Amendment of Unclassified Pay Plan for officers and employees
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and reordain the Unclassified Pay Plan for officers and employees in the unclassified service of the City of New Orleans to establish new positions and salary ranges within the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,765
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted by the council.
- Tags/Keywords: Unclassified Pay Plan, Sewerage and Water Board, salary ranges
- UID: 4b89d374-34fd-4fa4-be43-53d2adfc6cfa

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Disaster Recovery
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for the transfer and redevelopment of Hurricane Katrina and Rita-damaged private properties in Orleans Parish. The motion passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.

- Votes Summary:

- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend Section 146-146 to allow the Director of the Department of Public Works to authorize wider curb cuts than allowed by the Zoning Ordinance. The motion passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Fine for Demolition Without Certificate of Appropriateness in New Orleans Historic District
- Summary: This ordinance establishes a fine for causing the demolition of properties within the jurisdiction of the New Orleans Historic District and Landmarks Commission without first receiving a certificate of appropriateness. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,777
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Fine for Demolition Without Certificate of Appropriateness in Central Business District Historic District
- Summary: This ordinance amends and reordains Section 84-133 of the Code of the City of New Orleans to establish a fine for causing the demolition of properties within the jurisdiction of the Central Business District Historic District and Landmarks Commission without first receiving a certificate of appropriateness. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,778
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Federal Funds (Tropical Storm Cristobal)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Appropriation of Federal Grant Funds for Coroner's Office Investigator
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the operating budget to appropriate federal grant funds for the Orleans Parish DA's Office to acquire a full-time Coroner's Office investigator for fatal drug overdose investigations.
- Ordinance Number: 33,784
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed, allowing the appropriation of federal grant funds for the specified purpose.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Federal Grant, Coroner's Office Investigator
- UID: 4a3b54ae-bef0-4e2e-b6b1-1b92bea31eca

- Topic: Reestablishment of Task Force for Crisis Response Program
- Summary: The motion aims to reestablish the Task Force with existing membership to provide recommendations for the implementation of a crisis response program for Orleans Parish, focusing on behavioral health and substance abuse crises.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-311
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was passed, reestablishing the Task Force and setting a deadline for the final report with recommendations.
- Tags/Keywords: Task Force, Crisis Response Program, Behavioral Health, Substance Abuse
- UID: 4a3b54ae-bef0-4e2e-b6b1-1b92bea31eca

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Change and Conditional Use for Restaurant with Alcoholic Beverage Service
- Summary: The City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing to consider a zoning change from an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District to an HU-BIA Historic Urban Neighborhood Business District and to permit a conditional use to allow a standard restaurant with alcoholic beverage service in a specific area.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-312
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, and the City Planning Commission is directed to conduct the public hearing as specified.

- Summary: The City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing to consider a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, specifically to exempt an area between J-670 and Downman Road and to make recommendations for any other necessary amendments.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-313
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Not available in the provided information
- Decision/Key Actions: The City Planning Commission is directed to conduct the public hearing and study regulations in similarly situated municipalities for potential amendments.

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of Temporary Polling Locations for November 8, 2022 Election
- Summary: The ordinance proposed the establishment of temporary polling locations for specific precincts within the Parish of Orleans for the upcoming election. The original site was St. Dominic's School, and the new site proposed was the Edward Hynes Charter School Gym. The ordinance was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS, with 1 council member, Harris, absent.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-322
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the new polling locations were approved for the specified precincts.
- Tags/Keywords: Temporary Polling Locations, Election, Parish of Orleans, November 8, 2022, M-22-322
- UID: 13c1ff64-29be-4681-b060-a403bb507740

messages.page_content:

- Summary: The council voted to establish permanent polling places for various precincts within the Parish of Orleans. New locations were designated for precincts 06/07, 07/14, 07/15, 07/41, and 13/01.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (36 YEAS, 45 NAYS)

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Emergency Generator
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate Federal funds for the purchase of a generator to provide emergency backup power for a radio tower site used by public safety agencies in Orleans Parish.

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for New Orleans Police Department
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the operating budget to appropriate funds for unforeseen expenses related to relocating the New Orleans Police Department to the New Crime Lab. 
- Ordinance Number: 33805
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, allowing the appropriation of funds for the New Orleans Police Department's relocation.

- UID: 15821bf9-37d9-46a0-80ff-cea78fd1fe73

- Summary: This ordinance seeks to establish the New Orleans Recreation and Culture Fund as a division within the city's code, outlining specific sections within the division. 
- Ordinance Number: 33806
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- UID: 15821bf9-37d9-46a0-80ff-cea78fd1fe73

- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain regulations related to the city's use of surveillance technology.
